abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Year 2000 (Y2K)
            National Action Plan Support Project, is to assist the
            Government of Senegal in preventing disruptions in the
            economic and financial sectors, as a result of potential Y2K
            induced failures, in its government revenue and expenditure
            systems, customs systems, health, and infrastructure
            services. The strategic context calls for macroeconomic
            stability, improved private sector development, and
            alleviation of infrastructure bottlenecks, and it is within
            this context that the project will ensure adequate
            functioning of those sectors. The project time frame will be
            split in four phases, to include the following components:
            1) Project management will be strengthened, to cover overall
            supervision requirements, including weekly reporting to the
            Ministry of Scientific Research and Technology. This
            component include action priority selection, budget issues,
            and, training to increase awareness on Y2K risks. 2) Public
            sector systems, will cover the operation of critical
            information systems, managed by main administrative centers,
            public administration offices, state-owned enterprises, and,
            health facilities, including medical instruments. 3) Time
            constraints will hinder the readiness of all systems by
            December 31, 1999, hence, contingency plans will: a)
            globally target severe impacts on infrastructure, and, b)
            target sector-specific administrative functioning, to
            minimize potential adversities.
